an5.111:4.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five qualities who visits families is disliked and disapproved, not respected or admired.
an5.111:4.3: They act as though close to people they hardly know. They give away things they don’t own. They over-associate with close friends. They whisper in the ear. And they ask for too much.
an5.111:4.4: A mendicant with these five qualities who visits families is disliked and disapproved, not respected or admired.
an5.111:5.1: A mendicant with five qualities who visits families is liked and approved, respected and admired.
an5.111:5.3: They don’t act as though close to people they hardly know. They don’t give away things they don’t own. They don’t over-associate with close friends. They don’t whisper in the ear. And they don’t ask for too much.
an5.111:5.4: A mendicant with these five qualities who visits families is liked and approved, respected and admired.
